creator: cbarn@wabash.net
text:
My development machine is running Apache 1.3.24 and my Visual FoxPro 7 COM 
server works fine.  I have a "Hello World" test routine built into my .EXE.  I 
transferred the .EXE to my Windows 2000 server with Apache 2.0.45 and set up 
everything to run the COM server properly.  On that system my servertest only 
displays two odd characters as you'll see if you try the URL above.  Any 
thoughts?

BTW, I uninstalled 2.0.45 and installed 1.3.27 and the servertest works fine.  
Put 2.0.45 back on and the odd characters have returned.
creator: cbarn@wabash.net
slive@apache.org
text:
As the download page and documentation both tell you, the apache module api
is not compatible between 1.3 and 2.0.  Therefore 1.3 modules do not work
in 2.0 without modification.

I'm sorry, I don't understand.  My 2.0.45 machine had previously never had 1.3 
installed on it.  In order to get foxisapi.dll running (in any version) all I 
had to do was this in the virtual host section.

AddHandler isapi-isa .dll
<Directory  "c:/mywebs/mainsite/scripts/">
   AllowOverride None
   Options ExecCGI
   Order allow,deny
   Allo from all
</Directory>

So the AddHandler isapi-isa .dll line would've called a 2.0 module since 1.3 
had never been installed.  Unless you're saying that the isapi module hasn't 
been upgraded to 2.0 and they're bundling the 1.3 version with the 2.0 
installer.

I appreciate any clarification.  I always have the option of just going back to 
1.3 since it worked fine for my application.  However, I'd like to have the 
latest release if I can get it working.

Thanks,
Mike
creator: cbarn@wabash.net
slive@apache.org
text:
I was not aware that you were using isapi.  (I guess I should have looked
at the "component.)

But it is going to be pretty-much impossible for us to debug a problem with
a binary isapi module.  If you have the sourcecode for the module, you should
try to identify exactly where it is failing.  If you don't have the sourcecode,
you should probably contact the people who have it and ask them to debug the
problem.

creator: chip@force-elite.com
text: Do we support 3rd party ISAPI modules?
this is a 3rd party external module using ISAPI.  They need to talk to their vendor.
creator: chip@force-elite.com
